WorkItem.Description:
in response to Levva's reaction on my post on mmo-champions rawr related forum topic, I'd like to submit the following issue;
 
when I input my enhancement shaman's gear, and rotation into
Rawr.enhance 2.3.5, I get
8781.75 dps, with glyph of lightning shield, FS excluded from rotation. 
8723.98 dps, with glyph of lightning shield, FS included in the rotation.
8752.45 dps, with glyph of flame shock, FS included in rotation.
 
I did not expect those results, since it's commonly accepted since wow patch 3.3, that using flame shock in the enhancement priority rotation, is an improvement of dps.
 
when I export my rawr information to enhsim, version 1.9.5.4, I get:
8156.1 dps, with glyph of lightning shield, and FS excluded from rotation.
8201.13 dps, with glyph of lightning shield, and FS INcluded in the rotation.
8290.76 dps, with glyph of flame shock, and FS included in the rotation
 
which does display the normal/expected behaviour, of FS adding tot total damage. however, the difference in dps between both programs is quite large.
 
both XML's have been saved with +glyph of FS, and +FS in rotation
WorkItem.Summary: [Enhance] Excluding FS from rotation dps gain in Rawr, diff with enhsim

Comments.Message: Once EnhSim settles down after loads of recent updates I can spend time verifying that Rawr accurately matches what EnhSim is saying. Meantime this issue will be on hold.

Can you confirm that this still happens with the latest version of EnhSim? There was a big bug in EnhSim that overestimated the effects of FS glyph to the point where now the accepted wisdom is that it is not good for us.

V1.9.8.10 has the fix.

Fixed how the Glyph of Flame Shock was being applied for Work Item # 6927.
Ended up that the glyph was having too large of an impact on Flame Shock's damage.
It should now be more closely align to how the damage is on Live.

Using my own Shaman's file:
Rawr 2.3.23
12879.38, GoLS, no FlS
12934.67, GoLS, FlS above ES
12980.41, GoFlS, FlS above ES
So with FlS above ES in the priority, things look like they should be. Enhsim follows this behavior (there is a bit of a difference, but only about 200-300dps difference).  However, if I place FlS below ES in priority things get wierd (since FlS shouldn't fire at all theoretically).
12879.38, GoLS, no FlS
13569.50, GoLS, FlS below ES
13644.48, GoFlS, FlS below ES

Seems to be related to [workitem:16015]

My EnhSim results:

EnhSim 1.9.8.10
9772, GoLS, no FlS
10400, GoLS, FlS above ES
10385, GoFlS, FlS above ES

9772, GoLS, no FlS
9772, GoLS, FlS below ES
9721, GoFlS, FlS below ES

The much lower results more than likely are due to Strength of Wyrnn and some of my settings.  I posted this just to show the trend, not the overall values.
